repository_info.description: A Powerful web scraper powered by LLM | OpenAI, Gemini & Ollama

issues.title: Ollama usage issues
issues.body: Hey everyone, just needed a little clarity on the usage with ollama. I was trying to use local model using ollama (llama3.1 8b) but on querying about the website it always throws the error "An unexpected error occurred: HTTPSConnectionPool(host='openaipublic.blob.core.windows.net', port=443): Max retries exceeded with url: /encodings/o200k_base.tiktoken (Caused by NewConnectionError('<urllib3.connection.HTTPSConnection object at 0x7f9628608f20>: Failed to establish a new connection: Error connecting to SOCKS5 proxy 127.0.0.1:9050: [Errno 111] Connection refused')). Please try again or contact support if the issue persists.". Observing the logs , i see that my GPU keeps crashing. I have a RTX 2060S with 8 GB Vram. Was wondering what is the min requirement of Vram to run this locally, also is there a way to run this using Groq??Any help would be appreciated.
issues.author: kunwar-vikrant

comments.author: itsOwen
comments.body: Are you using it on Docker, right? Let me reproduce the error on Docker. I have only tested this natively. Also, are you trying to scrape from the Tor network, I suppose?

comments.author: kunwar-vikrant
comments.body: Nope , not using docker, using normal installation within a virtual environment on linux wsl. Also wasn't trying to scrape from TOR, just tried few news sites.

comments.author: itsOwen
comments.body:
> Nope , not using docker, using normal installation within a virtual environment on linux wsl. Also wasn't trying to scrape from TOR, just tried few news sites.

Hmm, WSL, I see. If you have access to a native Linux system, can you try that instead of WSL? Or, you could try Docker.

comments.author: 332plim
comments.body:
same issue reproduced on macos 15.1  M2 processor
not in docker. failed with both "current browser" on or off.  Observed program using the browser to visits the website

An unexpected error occurred: HTTPSConnectionPool(host='openaipublic.blob.core.windows.net', port=443): Max retries exceeded wi

comments.author: kunwar-vikrant
comments.body: @itsOwen Tried on native linux as well, same error is thrown. :(

issues.title: The webpage content seems to be a notice asking users to enable JavaScript and disable ad blockers.
issues.body:
Hello, 
     Everything is ok.Only has one problem "The webpage content seems to be a notice asking users to enable JavaScript and disable ad blockers." Seems the crawler can't support JavaScirpt and it's disabled to Scraped.How to solve it?

Kindly regards

James
issues.author: raintears2

comments.author: itsOwen
comments.body: Can you send the website you are trying to scrape and the prompt, so I can replicate the issue?

comments.author: raintears2
comments.body:
I tried to  scrape multi-Page https://www.idealista.com/en/alquiler-viviendas/valencia-provincia/pagina-{page}.htm 2-165
I used llama3.1:8b.
Then I asked "What are the prices below 800 euros?"
It replied as follows:

[ { "Price": "N/A", "Address": "N/A", "Description": "N/A" } ]

However, I c

comments.author: itsOwen
comments.body: Okay, so I managed to fix the JavaScript issue. It was my fault. I added another feature for websites that have CAPTCHAs. You can use the URL here -captcha and add "captcha" at the end. The browser window will pop up. Complete the CAPTCHA, and the bot will do the rest. However, the website you gave

issues.author: u8621011

comments.author: itsOwen
comments.body: Since I don't have a Windows machine, the program only works with Mac or Linux. I will try to push an update to fix it on Windows machines and check what the issue could be. Thanks for letting me know.

comments.author: itsOwen
comments.body: @u8621011 Windows Hotfix added, Can you test it for me please, There may be bugs but it will work.

comments.author: itsOwen
comments.body:
Docker container added, windows hotfix removed.

Now you can use a docker container on your windows machine to run the app.

issues.title: Please add support for more models - Ollama and Openrouter
issues.body: It would be great to have support for more models - especially Ollama and Openrouter.
issues.author: pathikb

comments.author: itsOwen
comments.body: Hey @pathikb I am currently working on adding local llms, I will look into it :)
